pyntacle.algorithms.local_topology module¶

Calculator of local properties of graphs

class LocalTopology(graph)[source]¶

Bases: object

Calculator of local properties of graphs [EXPAND?]

betweenness(index_list=None, recalculate=False)[source]¶

Computes the betweenness of every node in the graph, or of a specified list of nodes

Parameters:
  • index_list (list[int]) – List of node indices
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, the betweenness is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
Returns:

  • A list containing the betweenness values of the specified node indices. If an index is not specified, it returns a list of betweenness values for all nodes contained in the graph
Raises:

WrongArgumentError – When the input node index does not exist

Returns:

eigenvector_centrality(scaled=False, recalculate=False, index_list=None)[source]¶

Calculates the eigenvector centrality between all nodes in the graph using igraph builtin operators (Igraph.evc)

Parameters:
  • scaled (bool) – whether to normalize the eigenvector centrality (1/eigenvector value)
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, the eccentricity is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
Returns:

A list containing the radiality values of the specified node indices. If an index is not specified, it returns a list of radiality values for all nodes contained in the graph
Raises:

WrongArgumentError – if the input is not an igraph Graph object

pagerank(index_list=None, weights=None, damping=0.85, recalculate=False)[source]¶

Computes the pagerank index of every node in the graph, or of a specified list of nodes

Parameters:
  • index_list (list[int]) – List of node indices
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, the pagerank is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
  • damping (int) – a proposed damping factor
  • weights (list[int,float]) – a list of edge weights to apply to the pagerank algorithm
Returns:

A list containing the pagerank values of the specified node indices. If an index is not specified, it returns a list of pagerank values for all nodes contained in the graph
Raises:
  • WrongArgumentError – When the input node index does not exist
  • IllegalSizeArgument – if the weights length does not match the total size of the nodes
radiality(index_list=None, recalculate=False)[source]¶

Computes the radiality of every node in the graph, or of a specified list of nodes. The radiality of a node v is calculated by computing the shortest path between the node v and all other nodes in the graph. The value of each path is then subtracted by the value of the diameter + 1 and the resulting values are summated. Finally, the obtained value is divided for the number of nodes -1 (n-1).

Parameters:
  • index_list (list[int]) – List of node indices
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, the eccentricity is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
Returns:

  • A list containing the radiality values of the specified node indices. If an index is not specified, it returns a list of radiality values for all nodes contained in the graph
Raises:

WrongArgumentError – When the input node index does not exist
radiality_reach(index_list=None, recalculate=False)[source]¶

Computes a modified version of the radiality in which the radiality is computer for each component and then weighted over the proportion of nodes present in that component with respect to the total number of nodes in the graph. This ensures that the radiality [EXPAND]

Parameters:
  • index_list –
  • recalculate –
Returns:
set_graph(graph, deepcopy=False)[source]¶

Replaces the internal graph object with a new one

Parameters:

  • deepcopy (bool) – Flag determining shallow or deep copy of attributes of the graph
shortest_path(index_list=None, recalculate=False)[source]¶

Calculates the shortest path lengths between all (or a specified list of) nodes in the graph and every other nodes

Parameters:
  • index_list (list[int]) – List of node indices
  • recalculate (bool) – If True, the eccentricity is recalculated regardless if it had been already computed
Returns:

  • A list containing the shortest paths of the specified node indices. If an index is not specified, it returns a list of shortest paths from all nodes of the graph
Raises:

WrongArgumentError – When the input node index does not exist
